ENGAGED WITH "TRACK" BUTTON: copy track
ENGAGED WITH "CQ"BUTTON: copy seqeunce(everything in grid)
NOTES: these are the buttons above the top screen that have no led or screen information

ENGAGED WITH "TRACK" BUTTON: paste track
ENGAGED WITH "STEP" BUTTON: paste into step, 1 track may be pasted into 1 step which creates an insteption
ENGAGED WITH "CQ"BUTTON: allows pasting of copied seqeunce into step grid for recall with load feature
NOTES: in the step grid: the sequence you are on is lit green, the other saved seqeunces are red the unlit steps are free(nothing saved)

ENGAGED ALONE: step grid light up to save sequence into step grid
ENGAGED WITH "CQ"BUTTON: nothing
NOTES: in the step grid: the sequence you are on is lit green, the other saved seqeunces are red the unlit steps are free(nothing saved)

ENGAGED ALONE: select saved sequence from step grid
ENGAGED WITH "CQ"BUTTON: nothing
NOTES: in the step grid: the sequence you are on is lit green, the other saved seqeunces are red the unlit steps are free(nothing saved)

ENGAGED WITH "TRACK" BUTTON: ENGAGED WITH "TRACK" BUTTON
ENGAGED WITH "CQ"BUTTON: ENGAGED WITH "CQ"BUTTON
NOTES: NOTES

ENGAGED WITH "TRACK" BUTTON: adds a note to the existing note on every step; represented in semitones
ENGAGED WITH "STEP" BUTTON: adds a note to the existing note on that step; represented in semitones
ENGAGED WITH "CQ"BUTTON: text changes to VOLUME. controls master volume of synth output
NOTES: this is a tool used for creating chords. can also assist with the user being able to randomize chords as this can be included in the regeneration process. if no HRM tracks are turned on(not set to 0) then there is only one midi note able to be filled intot he step when regenerated. if HRM1 and 2 have values those slots will be filled with notes during regeneration.

ENGAGED WITH "TRACK" BUTTON: adds a note to the existing note on every step; represented in semitones
ENGAGED WITH "STEP" BUTTON: adds a note to the existing note on that step; represented in semitones
ENGAGED WITH "CQ"BUTTON: text changes to MODE; this changes the grid playback mode. selections are: horizontal, vertical, cartesian, barber pole
NOTES: HRM2 adds a second note.                                            STEPS is used to change the grid to how many tracks the user can view at once.  for instance in 16 step mode all 16 tracks are visible. in 256 step mode only 1 track is visible at a time. visible tracks are selected by track buttons

ENGAGED WITH "TRACK" BUTTON: adds a note to the existing note on every step; represented in semitones
ENGAGED WITH "STEP" BUTTON: adds a note to the existing note on that step; represented in semitones
ENGAGED WITH "CQ"BUTTON: text changes to STEPS which allows user to select the amount of steps each sequence is. selections are: 16,32,64,128,256
NOTES: adds a third note, harm1-3 can also be used creatively with the strum feature to create picking patterns. The HRM references the note programmed on the step and creates other notes that are semitones above or below the "base note"(note programmed on step)

ENGAGED WITH "TRACK" BUTTON: assigns strum to all steps
ENGAGED WITH "CQ"BUTTON: changes the envelope shape of velocity of strum notes. options triangle, ramp, saw, random,
NOTES: postive values strum up through the available notes, negative values strums down through the notes. see the octopus reference guide for strum patterns. strum up is base note, harm1, harm2, harm3. strum down is harm3, harm 2, harm1, root note

ENGAGED WITH "TRACK" BUTTON: ENGAGED WITH "TRACK" BUTTON
ENGAGED WITH "CQ"BUTTON: ENGAGED WITH "CQ"BUTTON
NOTES: NOTES

ENGAGED WITH "TRACK" BUTTON: offsets echo to all steps represented in fractions, x1 would equal 1 step, x2 would equal 2 steps
ENGAGED WITH "STEP" BUTTON: offsets echo on step represented in fractions, x1 would equal 1 step, x2 would equal 2 steps
ENGAGED WITH "CQ"BUTTON: offsets echo of all tracks
PUSH or PUSH TURN (encoders only): push click switches between readout and resolution of delay time
NOTES: this is midi echo. it is heavily based on the echo included in cubase by steinberg

ENGAGED WITH "TRACK" BUTTON: offsets feedback(repeat amount) to all steps
ENGAGED WITH "STEP" BUTTON: sets repeats of echo of that step
ENGAGED WITH "CQ"BUTTON: offsets feedback of all tracks

ENGAGED WITH "TRACK" BUTTON: adds/subtracts velocity offsets to each repeat of all steps
ENGAGED WITH "STEP" BUTTON: adds/subtracts velocity offset per repeat for that step
ENGAGED WITH "CQ"BUTTON: offsets echo velocity for all tracks
NOTES: if you enter a value of -10 then that means each repeat will be a value of 10 velocity lower than the previous one. a positive value would increase the velocity per repeat

ENGAGED WITH "TRACK" BUTTON: adds/subtracts pitch offsets to each repeat of all steps
ENGAGED WITH "STEP" BUTTON: adds/subtracts pitch offset per repeat of that step
ENGAGED WITH "CQ"BUTTON: adds/subtracts echo feedback pitch per repeat for all tracks
NOTES: if you enter a value of -10 then that means each repeat will be a value of 10 semitones(midi notes)lower than the previous one. a positive value would increase the velocity per repeat

ENGAGED WITH "TRACK" BUTTON: ENGAGED WITH "TRACK" BUTTON
ENGAGED WITH "CQ"BUTTON: ENGAGED WITH "CQ"BUTTON
NOTES: NOTES: THESE ARE TRACK ONLY ASSIGNMENTS

ENGAGED ALONE: illuminates track buttons that are LEADERS(default is track 1)
ENGAGED WITH "TRACK" BUTTON: selects track as leader
ENGAGED WITH "CQ"BUTTON: changes text to GLOBAL and allows user to access global setup menu
NOTES: leader is a top down function, a second leader starts a new set of followers

ENGAGED ALONE: illuminates track buttons that are FOLLOWERS
ENGAGED WITH "TRACK" BUTTON: selects tracks as followers
ENGAGED WITH "CQ"BUTTON: all tracks except leaders become followers. can be togged off/on; text is invertered when toggled on
NOTES: followers will normally reset to first stage in loop when leader reaches its first stage of loop.when a track is toggled off of leader or follower it is "free run"

ENGAGED ALONE: illuminates tracks that are one shots
ENGAGED WITH "TRACK" BUTTON: selects track as 1shot
ENGAGED WITH "STEP" BUTTON: selects the amount of times the 1shot plays through loop disregarding leader stage one reset then rests until  leader reaches step 1 of loop
ENGAGED WITH "CQ"BUTTON: all tracks except leaders become 1shots. can be togged off/on; text is invertered when toggled on

ENGAGED ALONE: toggles synth mode on. top display changes text to reflect names of synth edit parameters
ENGAGED WITH "TRACK" BUTTON: nothing
ENGAGED WITH "CQ"BUTTON: turns upper 16 encoders into volume level for each synth push turn any encoder for maseter volume(only when in synth mode)
NOTES: when engaged, the word synth becomes inverted. one TRACK BUTTON LED is brighter at a time letting the user know they are editing the synth of that track

ENGAGED WITH "TRACK" BUTTON: ENGAGED WITH "TRACK" BUTTON
ENGAGED WITH "CQ"BUTTON: ENGAGED WITH "CQ"BUTTON
NOTES: EVENTS are per step changes that only modify the track they are placed on. they  occur every time the chaselight crosses the step. whether the step is toggled off or on
C NOTES: Events are the attributes included on each step (button). They are expressed each time the button glows orange. The events will occur on mute but not when the step is toggled off.

ENGAGED WITH "TRACK" BUTTON: ONLY offsets steps with NOTE EVENTS
ENGAGED WITH "STEP" BUTTON: changes the NOTE EVENT value on step
ENGAGED WITH "CQ"BUTTON: offsets NOTE EVENTS on all steps in sequence
PUSH or PUSH TURN (encoders only): push click to set min/max range,effective if smaller than octave range of track.
NOTES: NOTE EVENTS are cummulative and add or subtract in semitones to all steps in a track. example: if you put +4 on step 1 and -2 on step 9 the math would continue to happen every time the track looped.

ENGAGED WITH "TRACK" BUTTON: ONLY offsets steps with GATE EVENTS
ENGAGED WITH "STEP" BUTTON: changes the GATE EVENT value on step
ENGAGED WITH "CQ"BUTTON: offsets GATE EVENTS on all steps in sequence
PUSH or PUSH TURN (encoders only): push click to set min/max value range
NOTES: GATE EVENTS are cumulative and add or subtract gate length in percentages to all steps in a track example: setting value to 10% will increase the gate length of every step in the track by 10% on each pass

ENGAGED WITH "TRACK" BUTTON: ONLY offsets steps with VELOCITY EVENTS
ENGAGED WITH "STEP" BUTTON: changes the VELOCITY EVENT value on step
ENGAGED WITH "CQ"BUTTON: offsets VELOCITY EVENTS on all steps in sequence
PUSH or PUSH TURN (encoders only): push click to set min/max value range
NOTES: VELOCITY EVENTS are cumulative and add or subtract velocity amount on all steps in a track example: setting value to 10% will increase the gate length of every step in the track by 10% on each pass

ENGAGED WITH "TRACK" BUTTON: ONLY offsets steps with REPEAT EVENTS
ENGAGED WITH "STEP" BUTTON: changes the REPEAT EVENT value on step
ENGAGED WITH "CQ"BUTTON: offsets REPEAT EVENTS on all steps in sequence
PUSH or PUSH TURN (encoders only): push click to set min/max value range
NOTES: REPEAT EVENTS repeat the step as many times as it set. negative values play the step once then "rest" on the step for the amount set. example set to 4 it would play the step once then rest for 3 durations of the step

ENGAGED WITH "TRACK" BUTTON: ENGAGED WITH "TRACK" BUTTON
ENGAGED WITH "CQ"BUTTON: ENGAGED WITH "CQ"BUTTON
NOTES: NOTES

ENGAGED WITH "TRACK" BUTTON: ONLY offsets steps with BEGIN EVENTS
ENGAGED WITH "STEP" BUTTON: changes the BEGIN EVENT value on step
ENGAGED WITH "CQ"BUTTON: offsets BEGIN EVENTS on all steps in sequence
PUSH or PUSH TURN (encoders only): push click says changes text to BOTH: locks begin and end events together. allowing loop to move and maintain same length
NOTES: BEGIN EVENTS move the beginning loop point by the amount of steps set(negative or positive values)

ENGAGED WITH "TRACK" BUTTON: ONLY offsets steps with END EVENTS
ENGAGED WITH "STEP" BUTTON: changes the END EVENT value on step
ENGAGED WITH "CQ"BUTTON: offsets END EVENTS on all steps in sequence
PUSH or PUSH TURN (encoders only): push click allow sequncer to move toggled on/off events.  ONLY AVAILABLE IF BEGIN EVENT is clicked to say BOTH
NOTES: END EVENTS move the ending loop point by the amount of steps set(negative or positve values)

ENGAGED WITH "TRACK" BUTTON: ONLY offsets steps with SHIFT EVENTS
ENGAGED WITH "STEP" BUTTON: changes the SHIFT EVENT value on step
ENGAGED WITH "CQ"BUTTON: offsets SHIFT EVENTS on all steps in sequence
PUSH or PUSH TURN (encoders only): hold switch in and all other encoders light up, you may select whether those attributes get moved by toggling the led off/on of encoder
NOTES: SHIFT EVENTS move attributes from steps to other steps(leaving loop points alone)(neg or pos values) does not move toggled on/off states

ENGAGED WITH "TRACK" BUTTON: sets amount the track can be affected by emit track. does not apply to pitch .default 100%
ENGAGED WITH "STEP" BUTTON: changes the AMNT VALUE on each step
ENGAGED WITH "CQ"BUTTON: nothing
NOTES: used to set value for EMIT tracks. also used to set percetage/range of regenerate(turn while pressing regen). when emit is included in the regen function it only changes the AMT set per step . it does not change the percentage of change to regen tracks or to collector tracks

ENGAGED WITH "TRACK" BUTTON: ENGAGED WITH "TRACK" BUTTON
ENGAGED WITH "CQ"BUTTON: ENGAGED WITH "CQ"BUTTON
NOTES: NOTES

ENGAGED ALONE: Illuminates step and track grid. STEPS show sequences current sequence is green, other sequences saved are red.  TRACKS are dim unless chained together(bright)
ENGAGED WITH "TRACK" BUTTON: chains tracks together to make longer playback in field. ex chain tracks 1-4 together and you get a 64 step pattern and the track 1-4 led become same color as track 1
ENGAGED WITH "STEP" BUTTON: step grid is used to slecect the sequences that play back after another. holding chain and pressing 1,1,2,2 would now play back the sequences in that order
ENGAGED WITH "CQ"BUTTON: toggles chain off and on, text inverts to show chain is active
NOTES: press chain with clear button to clear the chaining. while

ENGAGED ALONE: illuminates tracks that are set to be arp tracks
ENGAGED WITH "TRACK" BUTTON: selects track as an arp track
ENGAGED WITH "STEP" BUTTON: selects arp type for that track, only tracks that are set to arp will iluminate for change. step values 1=up, 2=dwn, 3=up/down, 4=random
ENGAGED WITH "CQ"BUTTON: makes all tracks arps except leaders this is a toggle feature and can be swapped back and forth
NOTES: an arp track is controlled by the track directly above it from the notes and gate lengths. if there is an external keyboard present you can play the arp by sending notes on midi chan 1-16. when arp button is pressed the display shows a number above the words "arp" this is the amount of octaves which can be set by turning the knob

ENGAGED ALONE: illuminates track buttons that are EMITTERS
ENGAGED WITH "TRACK" BUTTON: selects track as EMITTER
ENGAGED WITH "CQ"BUTTON: toggles all emit tracks off and on
NOTES: EMIT is a top down function, a second EMITTER starts a new set of COLLECTORS

ENGAGED ALONE: illuminates track buttons that are COLLECTORS
ENGAGED WITH "TRACK" BUTTON: selects track as COLLECTOR
ENGAGED WITH "CQ"BUTTON: toggles all collector tracks off and on
NOTES: COLLECTORS can be EMITTERS as well.                                  if a track is a collector and you hold down the track button the step grid will illuminate the first step which indicates NOTE is toggled on for mod matrix. you may toggle step 2(gate) and step 3(velocity) on to allow emit tracks AMT values to modulate these parameters as well. you may turn the AMT encoder to change the depth of modulation, which is displayed in percentages. values may be over 100%. the amount percentage has no effect on NOTE which is always set at 100%

ENGAGED WITH "TRACK" BUTTON: ENGAGED WITH "TRACK" BUTTON
ENGAGED WITH "CQ"BUTTON: ENGAGED WITH "CQ"BUTTON
NOTES: NOTES

ENGAGED ALONE: illuminates STEP grid for auto-regenerate selection
ENGAGED WITH "TRACK" BUTTON: immediately regenerates(randomizes) track
ENGAGED WITH "STEP" BUTTON: select how many loops before regeneration on track
ENGAGED WITH "CQ"BUTTON: immediately regenerates all steps in all tracks
NOTES: while holding regenerate button the encoders will illuminate. the user may toggle them in or out of the regenerate function. the AMT encoder becomes a percentage allowing the user to select a percentage value increase/decrease

ENGAGED ALONE: illuminuates STEP grid for auto remix selection
ENGAGED WITH "TRACK" BUTTON: remixes track immediately.
ENGAGED WITH "STEP" BUTTON: select how many loops before remix occurs on track
ENGAGED WITH "CQ"BUTTON: remixes all tracks
NOTES: remix only reorders the steps in the track. it does not randomize values. it does randomize how many steps are toggled off or on but it maintains all attributes inside a step and moves them inside the track

ENGAGED ALONE: illuminates track buttons to assign breed
ENGAGED WITH "TRACK" BUTTON: creates 2 "parent" tracks and one "child" track
ENGAGED WITH "CQ"BUTTON: toggle all breeders off or on
NOTES: example - assign breed to TRACK ONE: steps from TRACK ONE and TRACK TWO are used as a 50/50 coin toss to create track 3 (values are taken from steps that are off as well)

ENGAGED ALONE: freezes all remix, regen, and breeding
ENGAGED WITH "TRACK" BUTTON: not applicable
ENGAGED WITH "CQ"BUTTON: not applicable
NOTES: when toggled on the mod display has asterisks in the center row

ENGAGED WITH "TRACK" BUTTON: ENGAGED WITH "TRACK" BUTTON
ENGAGED WITH "CQ"BUTTON: ENGAGED WITH "CQ"BUTTON
NOTES: What are known as "macroMOD" and "microMOD" microMOD - multiple CYCLES of the SHAPE may be placed on one step(think vibrato). macroMOD - SHAPE can be set to occur over multiple STEPS including over multiple loop lengths

ENGAGED WITH "TRACK" BUTTON: "cycle mode":apply shape to all steps | "step mode": apply shape over loop
ENGAGED WITH "CQ"BUTTON: offsets shape to all steps in sequence
PUSH or PUSH TURN (encoders only): skews shape on track or step depending
NOTES: options: tri, rmp, saw, sqr, ?!? other shapes from latronic notron and nemo to follow in future updates

ENGAGED WITH "TRACK" BUTTON: offsets MIN or MAX(which is selected) on steps in track
ENGAGED WITH "STEP" BUTTON: offsets MIN or MAX(selected) on step
ENGAGED WITH "CQ"BUTTON: offsets MIN or MAX(selected) to all steps in sequence
PUSH or PUSH TURN (encoders only): push toggles between MIN, MAX or BOTH for edit
NOTES: when a destination is set MIN is automatically set to the destinations offset.

ENGAGED WITH "TRACK" BUTTON: offsets CYCLES or STEPS(selected) on steps in track
ENGAGED WITH "STEP" BUTTON: offsets CYCLES or STEPS(selected) on step
ENGAGED WITH "CQ"BUTTON: offsets CYCLES/STEPS(selected) to all steps in seq
PUSH or PUSH TURN (encoders only): push toggles between CYCLES or STEPS for edit
NOTES: when CYCl is toggled this is what is referred to as a "microMOD"                                                               when STEP is stelected this is "macroMOD"

ENGAGED WITH "TRACK" BUTTON: sets(not offset) DESTINATION on steps in track to each modulator
ENGAGED WITH "STEP" BUTTON: sets DESTINATION to modulator on step(s)
ENGAGED WITH "CQ"BUTTON: offsets DESTINATION to all steps in sequence
NOTES: DESTINATION can be sent to internal controls of any sequencer track or to external MIDI CC user may also modulate modulators. When CQ button is engaged and this encoder is pressed it will mute/sever the detination

ENGAGED WITH "TRACK" BUTTON: ENGAGED WITH "TRACK" BUTTON
ENGAGED WITH "CQ"BUTTON: ENGAGED WITH "CQ"BUTTON
NOTES: NOTES

ENGAGED WITH "TRACK" BUTTON: "cycle mode":apply shape to all steps | "step mode": apply shape over loop
ENGAGED WITH "CQ"BUTTON: offsets shape to all steps in sequence
PUSH or PUSH TURN (encoders only): skews shape on track or step depending
NOTES: options: tri, rmp, saw, sqr, ?!? other shapes from latronic notron and nemo to follow in future updates

ENGAGED WITH "TRACK" BUTTON: offsets MIN or MAX(which is selected) on steps in track
ENGAGED WITH "STEP" BUTTON: offsets MIN or MAX(selected) on step
ENGAGED WITH "CQ"BUTTON: offsets MIN or MAX(selected) to all steps in sequence
PUSH or PUSH TURN (encoders only): push toggles between MIN, MAX or BOTH for edit
NOTES: when a destination is set MIN is automatically set to the destinations offset.

ENGAGED WITH "TRACK" BUTTON: offsets CYCLES or STEPS(selected) on steps in track
ENGAGED WITH "STEP" BUTTON: offsets CYCLES or STEPS(selected) on step
ENGAGED WITH "CQ"BUTTON: offsets CYCLES/STEPS(selected) to all steps in seq
PUSH or PUSH TURN (encoders only): push toggles between CYCLES or STEPS for edit
NOTES: when CYCl is toggled this is what is referred to as a "microMOD"                                                               when STEP is stelected this is "macroMOD"

ENGAGED WITH "TRACK" BUTTON: sets(not offset) DESTINATION on steps in track to each modulator
ENGAGED WITH "STEP" BUTTON: sets DESTINATION to modulator on step(s)
ENGAGED WITH "CQ"BUTTON: offsets DESTINATION to all steps in sequence
NOTES: DESTINATION can be sent to internal controls of any sequencer track or to external MIDI CC user may also modulate modulators. When CQ button is engaged and this encoder is pressed it will mute/sever the detination

ENGAGED WITH "TRACK" BUTTON: ENGAGED WITH "TRACK" BUTTON
ENGAGED WITH "CQ"BUTTON: ENGAGED WITH "CQ"BUTTON
NOTES: NOTES

ENGAGED ALONE: undo change to sequencer. level of undo to be specified by coder
ENGAGED WITH "TRACK" BUTTON: nothing
ENGAGED WITH "CQ"BUTTON: changes text to say template 1 a quick press changes to template 1 a long press(3-5 seconds) saves currect sequencer state as a template. text flashes "SAVED"
NOTES: yup

ENGAGED WITH "TRACK" BUTTON: nothing
ENGAGED WITH "CQ"BUTTON: template 2
NOTES: yep

ENGAGED WITH "TRACK" BUTTON: nothing
ENGAGED WITH "STEP" BUTTON: toggles insteption feature off and on of a step
ENGAGED WITH "CQ"BUTTON: template 3
NOTES: opens the track step grid up to allow programming of a sequence within a step. think of it as a set of steps inside of a step.  step led lights purple and flashes in time with running through the steps when chaselight it on step

ENGAGED WITH "TRACK" BUTTON: toggles feature on/ff on track
ENGAGED WITH "STEP" BUTTON: press 2 steps to set the octave range
ENGAGED WITH "CQ"BUTTON: template 4
NOTES: defines range of notes for editing, modulation, and regeneration. when note range is met (high or low) it "wraps around" example: range is set midi note 20-30; receiving a modulation ramp wave of 15 would peak at midi note 25

ENGAGED WITH "TRACK" BUTTON: ENGAGED WITH "TRACK" BUTTON
ENGAGED WITH "CQ"BUTTON: ENGAGED WITH "CQ"BUTTON
NOTES: NOTES

ENGAGED WITH "TRACK" BUTTON: applies swing or jitter to track
ENGAGED WITH "STEP" BUTTON: applied an offset of start time to specific step. this is in addition to track offset
ENGAGED WITH "CQ"BUTTON: adds jitter to global tempo
NOTES: see octopus reference manual page 46 GRV table for jitter function

ENGAGED WITH "TRACK" BUTTON: changes direction of playback
ENGAGED WITH "STEP" BUTTON: changes direction to next step when in cartesian mode
ENGAGED WITH "CQ"BUTTON: offsets direction of all tracks in sequence
PUSH or PUSH TURN (encoders only): text changes to AXIS and allows user to scroll through playback directions of entire grid
NOTES: in cartesian mode this can be used to "pac man/Nokia Snake game around"  forcing the next step UP/DOWN/LEFT/RIGHT

ENGAGED ALONE: w/sequencer stopped can scrub through sequence
ENGAGED WITH "TRACK" BUTTON: rotates assigned attributes of steps includinged toggle on/off and loop points
ENGAGED WITH "CQ"BUTTON: rotates all attributes from one track to another

ENGAGED WITH "TRACK" BUTTON: changes midi channel of track
ENGAGED WITH "CQ"BUTTON: offsets all tracks midi channels
PUSH or PUSH TURN (encoders only): swtiches betwen midi out A , midi out B, midi out C, or midi out D

ENGAGED WITH "TRACK" BUTTON: ENGAGED WITH "TRACK" BUTTON
ENGAGED WITH "CQ"BUTTON: ENGAGED WITH "CQ"BUTTON
NOTES: NOTES

ENGAGED WITH "TRACK" BUTTON: offsets note value on all steps in track
ENGAGED WITH "CQ"BUTTON: offsets all notes in sequence
PUSH or PUSH TURN (encoders only): changes readout values(midi note#, hrtz, note)

ENGAGED WITH "TRACK" BUTTON: offsets gate value on all steps in track
ENGAGED WITH "CQ"BUTTON: offsets all gate length values in seqeunce
PUSH or PUSH TURN (encoders only): click down to extend range beyond 100%

ENGAGED WITH "TRACK" BUTTON: offsets velocity value on all steps in track
ENGAGED WITH "CQ"BUTTON: offsets all velocity values in sequence

ENGAGED WITH "TRACK" BUTTON: multiplies or divides track playback by tempo
ENGAGED WITH "STEP" BUTTON: multiplies or divides step playback by track time
ENGAGED WITH "CQ"BUTTON: defaults to always changing global tempo

ENGAGED WITH "TRACK" BUTTON: ENGAGED WITH "TRACK" BUTTON
ENGAGED WITH "CQ"BUTTON: ENGAGED WITH "CQ"BUTTON
NOTES: NOTES

ENGAGED WITH "TRACK" BUTTON: mutes track
ENGAGED WITH "CQ"BUTTON: inverts muted and unmuted steps on all tracks
NOTES: when a step is muted the sequencer just acts as if the step is toggled off EXCEPTION: EVENTs and MODs  are still generated

ENGAGED WITH "TRACK" BUTTON: clears track
ENGAGED WITH "CQ"BUTTON: hold for 2 seconds to clear entire sequence
NOTES: holding clear encoders and buttons will illuminate allowing user to exclude attributes from being cleared

ENGAGED WITH "TRACK" BUTTON: inverts skipped and non skipped steps on track. example: if skipped steps were set to 1 and 8 the loop points would now be 9 and 16.
ENGAGED WITH "STEP" BUTTON: skips the step which turns off the led
ENGAGED WITH "CQ"BUTTON: inverts skipped steps on entire sequence

ENGAGED ALONE: switches between sequence A and B
ENGAGED WITH "TRACK" BUTTON: changes track to A or B
ENGAGED WITH "CQ"BUTTON: sets playback to alternate AB or AAAB text becomes capitalized and current sequence playing is inverted

ENGAGED WITH "TRACK" BUTTON: ENGAGED WITH "TRACK" BUTTON
ENGAGED WITH "CQ"BUTTON: ENGAGED WITH "CQ" BUTTON
NOTES: NOTES

ENGAGED ALONE: toggles all track in and out of editing(multiple tracks selected at once)
ENGAGED WITH "TRACK" BUTTON: toggles that track in and out of the group selection
ENGAGED WITH "STEP" BUTTON: used to select steps in the track for "global edit" when a step is slected in a track only these steps will be edited when encoders are turned
ENGAGED WITH "CQ"BUTTON: toggles on all deselected tracks so that ALL tracks are in included in selectrion again
NOTES: when this button is toggled on all tracks that are illuminated are being edited. this means if you turn a knob or push a button it offsets or effects each track

ENGAGED WITH "TRACK" BUTTON: nothing
ENGAGED WITH "CQ"BUTTON: cue executes on leader "begin of loop"
NOTES: while the led is blinking the user may edit attributes to the entire sequencer. the changes will not be executed until the cue button is pressed again

ENGAGED WITH "TRACK" BUTTON: ENGAGED WITH "TRACK" BUTTON
ENGAGED WITH "CQ"BUTTON: ENGAGED WITH "CQ"BUTTON
NOTES: NOTES

ENGAGED ALONE: toggles recorded edits loop off and on
ENGAGED WITH "TRACK" BUTTON: nothing
ENGAGED WITH "CQ"BUTTON: starts/stops recording of button presses and encoder turns to create a loop of parameter changes
NOTES: this is basically like a midi looper/recorder for all the controls of the seqeuncer that can be turned off and on.

ENGAGED WITH "TRACK" BUTTON: records midi data onto track(s) selected
ENGAGED WITH "CQ"BUTTON: snap to grid  record. led flashes
NOTES: this is mostly used to record external sources plugged into the midi or usb inputs

ENGAGED ALONE: stops sequencer.         when pressed twice it sends a midi panic(all notes off)
ENGAGED WITH "TRACK" BUTTON: stops that track a second press will start the track again
ENGAGED WITH "CQ"BUTTON: starts all stopped tracks
NOTES: srsly? its a fucking stop button

ENGAGED ALONE: starts sequencer.     everytime it is pressed while sequencer is running ALL the FOLLOWER tracks alligh to the step the leader is on
ENGAGED WITH "TRACK" BUTTON: nothing
ENGAGED WITH "CQ"BUTTON: starts sequencer. everytime it is pressed while sequencer is running it will allign ALL the tracks to the step the leader is on

ENGAGED WITH "TRACK" BUTTON: ENGAGED WITH "TRACK" BUTTON
ENGAGED WITH "CQ"BUTTON: ENGAGED WITH "CQ" BUTTON
NOTES: NOTES

ENGAGED ALONE: when in ANALOG EDIT mode this is used to cursor to tracks. when in FOCUS MODE this is used to cursor to tracks
ENGAGED WITH "TRACK" BUTTON: offsets all steps on track  by +3 semitones
ENGAGED WITH "CQ"BUTTON: increase master tempo by 1 bpm
NOTES: i am sure we will find other uses for these during development

ENGAGED ALONE: when in ANALOG EDIT mode this is used to cursor to tracks. when in FOCUS MODE this is used to cursor to tracks
ENGAGED WITH "TRACK" BUTTON: offsets all steps on track  by -3 semitones
ENGAGED WITH "CQ"BUTTON: decrease master tempo by 1 bpm
NOTES: i am sure we will find other uses for these during development

ENGAGED ALONE: when in ANALOG EDIT mode this is used to cursor to tracks. when in FOCUS MODE this is used to cursor to sequences if they are chained together. if the sequencer is stopped this can be used to move all tracks back one step on each press and play the attributes located in steps
ENGAGED WITH "TRACK" BUTTON: offsets all steps on track by -7 semitones
ENGAGED WITH "CQ"BUTTON: decrease master tempo by 10 bpm
NOTES: i am sure we will find other uses for these during development

ENGAGED ALONE: when in ANALOG EDIT mode this is used to cursor to tracks. when in FOCUS MODE this is used to cursor to sequences if they are chained together. if hte sequencer is stopped this can be used to move all tracks forward one step on each press and play the attributes located in steps
ENGAGED WITH "TRACK" BUTTON: offsets all steps on track by +7 semitones
ENGAGED WITH "CQ"BUTTON: increase master tempo by 10 bpm
NOTES: i am sure we will find other uses for these during development

ENGAGED WITH "TRACK" BUTTON: ENGAGED WITH "TRACK" BUTTON
ENGAGED WITH "CQ"BUTTON: ENGAGED WITH "CQ"BUTTON
NOTES: NOTES

ENGAGED ALONE: changes screen text to show "shift features" other buttons and knobs are illuminated to show they can be engaged with.
ENGAGED WITH "TRACK" BUTTON: nothing
ENGAGED WITH "STEP" BUTTON: step pitch is locked, it will not be effected by regeneration, modulation, events or breeding
ENGAGED WITH "CQ"BUTTON: not applicable
NOTES: when this button is held and a knob is turned or a button is pressed  it applies those offsets to all tracks(if master track button is toggled off)    if MASTER TRACK button is toggled on the attribute offsets are only applied to those tracks

ENGAGED WITH "TRACK" BUTTON: shifts all steps on track up and octave 12 midi notes
ENGAGED WITH "STEP" BUTTON: shifts note(s) on step up an octave 12 midi notes
ENGAGED WITH "CQ"BUTTON: moves all tracks up an octave 12 midi notes

ENGAGED WITH "TRACK" BUTTON: shifts tracks steps on track down and octave
ENGAGED WITH "STEP" BUTTON: shifts note(s) on step down an octave
ENGAGED WITH "CQ"BUTTON: moves all tracks down an octave

ENGAGED WITH "TRACK" BUTTON: shifts tracks up or down in semitones lower octave is down upper octave is up
ENGAGED WITH "CQ"BUTTON: applies semitone offset to entire sequencer or selected tracks(if master track button is engaged)
NOTES: when scale mode is engaged the keyboard area will allow you to subtract notes from the 12 semitone scale. this is called "force to scale". this function can be applied to the entire sequencer, tracks, or steps.

ENGAGED WITH "TRACK" BUTTON: erases force to scale on that track if there is one
ENGAGED WITH "STEP" BUTTON: erases force to scale on that step if there is one
ENGAGED WITH "CQ"BUTTON: sets current scale to be global and will flash if this is engaged. you may toggle it off or on
NOTES: scales may be saved in the screens we will discuss how we want to do this before i start working too hard on it. force to scale is done last in the chain of midi events

ENGAGED WITH "TRACK" BUTTON: ENGAGED WITH "TRACK" BUTTON
ENGAGED WITH "CQ"BUTTON: ENGAGED WITH "CQ"BUTTON
NOTES: NOTES

ENGAGED ALONE: toggles focus on. must press FOCUS button to exit. allows user to view a sequence when chained, default behavior is to "follow chase light"
ENGAGED WITH "TRACK" BUTTON: nothing
ENGAGED WITH "CQ"BUTTON: forces sequencer to loop on step or pattern that is being focused on. lamens terms "loops whats in view on step grid"
NOTES: while in this mode you can use rigth and left arrows to scroll thorugh sequences

ENGAGED ALONE: toggles direct on(per track), led is toggled on must use home to exit. while sequencer is running if this mode is toggled on the user may touch a step button and the sequencer will just to that step. if button is help sequencer will repeat step until it is let  go. if the sequencer is stopped the user may just press buttons sounding each one of them at a time.
ENGAGED WITH "TRACK" BUTTON: nothing
ENGAGED WITH "CQ"BUTTON: toggles direct on(per sequence), led flashes must use home to exit. while sequencer is  the user may touch a step button and the all tracks  will jump to that step. if button is help sequencer will repeat steps until it is let  go. if the sequencer is stopped the user may just press a button sounding every step in that "column".

ENGAGED ALONE: while being held user may push turn encoders to set midi channel and turn encoder to set CC number/ this allows the user to turn these knobs and send cc messages out of the unit when no other buttons are being pressed or latched. only applies to top 16 encoders
ENGAGED WITH "TRACK" BUTTON: when CC is being held each button on the step grid 1-127 sends out a midi cc of that value. top grid is midi A output lower grid is midi B output. the illuminated track changes the midi channel.
ENGAGED WITH "CQ"BUTTON: turns CC mode on(toggles led on) which allows the user to sequence 16 midi CCs per step. in this mode the midi channel is ignored and the CC number and value is written to the step and is sent on the number the channel or step is set to

ENGAGED WITH "TRACK" BUTTON: ENGAGED WITH "TRACK" BUTTON
ENGAGED WITH "CQ"BUTTON: ENGAGED WITH "CQ"BUTTON
NOTES: NOTES

ENGAGED ALONE: if you are in any toggled state this just immediately takes you to the default/home screen. led flashes when button can be used
toggles on piano edit mode led stays lit. only way to escape is pressing home button
ENGAGED WITH "TRACK" BUTTON: when toggled on this selects the row/track being edited. if the track is 16 steps or less track selects the track, if more than sixteen steps the track buttons select the row. when more than 16 steps user may hold the button and the track you are editing illuminutes if you press another track it will switch to editing that track
ENGAGED WITH "STEP" BUTTON: if there is an insteption it opens it for PIANO ROLL style editing. if there is not an insteption it creates one and opens it up in that way
ENGAGED WITH "CQ"BUTTON: loops the area you are in. led blinks this shortcut toggles on "focus mode"
PUSH or PUSH TURN (encoders only): hold button while pressing oct up or down to shift the base midi note of each row 12 midi notes
NOTES: when this is engaged the grid becomes like a piano roll editor. the default is as follows:                                   tracks/rows 1-16 are equal to midi note numbers 57-72 (A3-C5). white keys and black keys should be two different led colors.

ENGAGED ALONE: toggles on analog edit mode. only way to escape this is to press home button
ENGAGED WITH "TRACK" BUTTON: when toggled on this selects the row/track being edited. if the track is 16 steps or less track selects the track, if more than sixteen steps the track buttons select the row. when more than 16 steps user may hold the button and the track you are editing illuminutes if you press another track it will switch to editing that track
ENGAGED WITH "STEP" BUTTON: if there is an insteption it opens it for analog style editing. if there is not an insteption it creates one and opens it up in that way
ENGAGED WITH "CQ"BUTTON: loops the area you are in. led blinks this shortcut toggles on "focus mode". presseing analog button again simply ends the focus mode
PUSH or PUSH TURN (encoders only): hold button while pressing oct up or down to shift the base midi note of each row 12 midi notes
NOTES: this is an edit mode that allows the user to turn the encoders to change values on steps of selected tracks.  when it opens the default is turning the encoder changes the note value, pushing the enoder toggles the step off and on. in order to change what the encoders are editing the user may select the attribute by engaging the touch screen and turning a knob. the encoder light to same color of track they are editing and the chaselight is reflected there as well.

ENGAGED WITH "TRACK" BUTTON: DIM
ENGAGED WITH "CQ"BUTTON: HIGH BRIGHT

ENGAGED ALONE: step is skipped or outside of loop. chaselight ignores this step
ENGAGED WITH "TRACK" BUTTON: step is toggled off. chaselight rests on this step as long as time is set during playback
ENGAGED WITH "STEP" BUTTON: step is toggled on all attributes are played on this step
ENGAGED WITH "CQ"BUTTON: has a velocity above 120

ENGAGED ALONE: step is skipped or outside of loop. chaselight ignores this step
ENGAGED WITH "TRACK" BUTTON: step is toggled off. chaselight rests on this step as long as time is set during playback
ENGAGED WITH "STEP" BUTTON: step is toggled on all attributes are played on this step
ENGAGED WITH "CQ"BUTTON: has a velocity above 120

ENGAGED WITH "TRACK" BUTTON: track not being edited
ENGAGED WITH "CQ"BUTTON: track being edited

ENGAGED WITH "STEP" BUTTON: PURPLE ON STEPS means step is INSTEPTION. double clicking or holding "INSTEP" button while pressing step will create and open and insteption
PUSH or PUSH TURN (encoders only): when an insteption is "zoomed into" all of the steps will turn dim purple. when steps are toggled on they will be bright purple, if steps are skipped they will be unlit.  the chase light is yellow. orange steps are muted steps

ENGAGED ALONE: orange led is also used for muted steps orange led is used for modes that are toggled states
NOTES: when a step is muted only the "note on/gate" is NOT generated. all other attributes ARE generated
